content: Nvidia Broadcast is incredibly useful and makes my video calls much better. I would highly recommend it.
I really like how Nvidia lets you stream games with GeForce Now. It's pretty good if you have a good connection.
NVIDIA AI is a great tool to broadcast, encode, and game like a pro, all from one PC. It definitely levels up your stream.
Nvidia Broadcast for RTX GPUs offers quality over specs, which is a worthwhile trade-off.
It's frustrating that a powerful GTX 1080 Ti can't blur backgrounds in NVIDIA Broadcast, requiring an RTX GPU.
Nvidia Broadcast has amazing noise cancellation, so I think this card is worth it if you work from home.
Nvidia Broadcast has amazing noise cancellation, making this card worth it if you work from home.
Nvidia Broadcast's AI noise removal for the microphone is great. The AI detects voice and removes the noise.
Nvidia RTX series cards have Nvidia Broadcast software available and enhance the streaming experience.
My 6-month-old model has constant high temperatures, reaching 96-97C in performance mode. I suspect the thermal paste needs replacement.
My laptop's GPU TGP is only 50W, and the CPU is bottlenecking it. I get 100-150fps in Valorant and 35-45fps in The Finals.
I also have the same laptop, and it's a beast for the price I paid. The battery life is awesome, lasting 5 hours.
